gurmukhi: Aaur Aaur jy suBit gno iqh nwm ibc`Cn ] bf joDw bf sUr bfy ijqvwr sul`Cn ]
transliteration: Aur Aur Je Soubhattee Gado Tih Naam Bichachchhan|| Bad Jodhaa Bad Soor Bade Jitvaar Sulachchhan||
translation: The names of other warriors are fantastic also; they are all very brave and conquerors of wars;

gurmukhi: klih nwm iek nwir mhw kl rUp klh kr ] log cqurds mwiJ jws Corw nhI sur nr ]
transliteration: Kalah(i) Naam Ik Daar(i) Mahaa Kal Roop Kalah Kar|| Log Chturdas Maajh(i) Jaas Chhodhaa Nahisur Nar||
translation: There is one woman named Kalha, whose figure is very hideous, she has not left untouched any god or man in all the fourteen worlds;

gurmukhi: sB SsqR AsqR BIqr inpx Aiq pRBwv iqh jwnIAY ] sB dys Bys Aru rwj sB qRws jvn kO mwnIAY ]177]
transliteration: Sabh Shastra Astra Bheetar Nipan At(i) Prabhaav Tih Jaaneeai|| Sabh Des Bhes Ar(u) Raaj Sabh Traas Javan Kau Maaneeai||177||
translation: The warriors skilful in arms and weapons and very influential fighters and the kings of the countries far and near are fearful of her.177.

gurmukhi: bYr nwm iek bIr mhw durDrK AjY rx ] kbhu dIn nhI pIiT Aink jIqy ijh niRp gx ]
transliteration: Bair Naam Ik Beer Mahaa Durdharakh Ajai Ran|| Kabahu Deen Nahipith(i) Anik Jeete Jih Nrip Gad||
translation: There is one invincible warriors named Shaturta (enmity) who has never shown his back and has conquered many kings;

gurmukhi: locn sRoxq brx Arn sB SsqR AMig iqh ] rIv pRkwS sr Dujw Arx lwjq lK Cib ijh ]
transliteration: Lochanndsronat Baran Aran Sabh Shastra An(i) Tih|| Rav(i) Prakaadh Sa Dhujaa Aran Laajat Lakh Chhab(i) Jih||
translation: His eyes and colour were red like blood and there were weapons on all the limbs; his banner was like sunshine and seeing his brilliance, even the sun felt shy;

gurmukhi: ieh BwNq bYr bIrw bfo jidn kRu`D kir grij hY ] ibnu eyk SwNq sun ry niRpiq su Aaur n dUsr brij hY ]178]
transliteration: Eh Bhaant Bair Beeraa Bado Jadin Kruddh Kar(i) Gadaj(i) Hai|| Bin(u) Ek Shaant Soun Re Nripat(i) Su Aur Na Doosar Baraj(i) Hai||178||
translation: In this way, this mighty warriors named Shaturta, will roar in anger, on that day, none else will confront him except Shanti (peace).178.

gurmukhi: DUmR Dujw rQ DUmR DUmR swrQI ibrwjq ] DUmR bsqR qn Dro inrK DUAro mn lwjq ]
transliteration: Dhoomra Dhujaa Rath Dhoomra Dhoomra Saarthibiraajat|| Dhoomra Bastra Tan Dhato Nirakh Dhodaro Man Laajat||
translation: The back banner, black chariot and the black charioteer look splendid; seeing the black garment, even the smoke feels shy in his mind;

gurmukhi: DUmR DnuK kr CkXo bwn DUmry suhwey ] sur nr nwg BUjMg j`C Ar Asur ljwey ]
transliteration: Dhoomra Dhanoukh Kar Chhakyo Baan Dhoodare Suhaae|| Sur Nar Naag Bhoojan Jachchh Ar Asur Lajaae||
translation: There are black arrows for his block how; seeing him the gods, men serpents, Yakshas and demons feel shy;

gurmukhi: ieh Cb pRBwv Awls niRpq jidn ju`D kh ju`t hY ] au`dm ibhIn sun ry niRpq Aaur skl dl Pu`t hY ]179]
transliteration: Eh Chhab Prabhaav Aalas Nripat Jadin Juddh Kah Joutt Hai|| Uddam Biheen Soun Re Nripat Aur Sakal Dal Phoutt Hai||179||
translation: O king ! this impressive beauty is of Aalas (laziness) and O king ! the day he will confront you for fighting, your army without diligence will be fragmented.179.

gurmukhi: hirq Dujw Aru DnK hirq bwjI rQ soBn ] hirq bsqR qn Dry inrK sur nr mn mohq ]
transliteration: Harit Dhujaa Ar(u) Dhanakh Harit Baajirath Sobhan|| Harit Bastra Tan Ddare Nirakh Sur Nar Mam Mohat||
translation: Seeing the one having green banner, green bow, green horses, green chariots and wearing green clothes on the body, the gods and men are allured;
